result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Charles Hughes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing [Modifiers: Penalty - Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Adam Charles Hughes in court with attorney Sean P Drury. Defendant Adam Charles Hughes in custody. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are: 14TR-104, 14TR-105, 14TR-106, 14TR-107, 14TR-108, 14TR-109, 14CF-223, and 14CF-9. 

10:08 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Isherwood states appearances.

The state has filed an amended information.
Defendant will plead to the three counts in the amended information.
Defendant will plead to 14TR-104, 107, 108 and 109. 
Sentence withheld, 18 mo prob, 40 hrs comm svcs, aoda and comply with treatment recommendations, abs sob, ft empt/school or combo, other counseling as recommended.
Factual basis in the TR cases are in the criminal cases, fine amount on citations.
Defendant has a new case pending but will be addressed at a later time.
14CF-223 is set for a preliminary hearing on Monday.
14CF-9 is the criminal case being sentenced on.

Atty Drury has received a copy of he amended information for 14CF-9 and waives reading.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.


Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST 14CF-9 Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 14CF-9 Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 14CF-9 Count 3
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 14TR-104
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 14TR-107
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 14TR-108
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 14TR-109 PBT. 17

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
Defendant concurs previous convictions.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF-9: Count 1: 346.04(2t)
14CF-9: Count 2: 946.41(1) and 939.62(1)(a)
14CF-9: Count 3: 961.573(1) and 939.62(1)(a)
14TR-104: Speeding
14TR-107: Fail to stop at stop sign
14TR-108: Operating left of center
14TR-109: OWI
14TR-105: Dismissed and read in
14TR-106: Dismissed and read in

Atty Isherwood addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Atty Drury addresses the Court prior to sentencing, requests cash bond to be applied to costs.
Court agrees with recommendations.

BY THE COURT:
14CF-9
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 18 Months
Conditions:
Perform 40 Hours of Community Service
AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations
Maintain absolute sobriety
Maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time
Participate and comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent
Pay costs
19 Days Jail Credit in the event Defendant is revoked

Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 18 Months concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1
Pay costs

Count 3:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 18 Months concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1 and Count 2
Pay costs

$200 cash bond is to be applied towards the costs

14TR-104:
Pay $250.90. 60 days to pay or set up payment plan

14TR-107:
Pay $175.30. 60 days to pay or set up payment plan

14TR-108:
Pay $21310. 60 days to pay or set up payment plan

14TR-109:
Pay a fine and costs in the amoutn of $1000.50. 60 days to pay or set up payment plan
15 Month IID, commencing TODAY
9 Month DL Revocation retroactive to the first day of any administrative suspension
DOT assessment

$5,000 cash bond:   Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription  and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.    Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License.  If bond is posted, then Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

***3/28/14 Bond is being amended from $5,000 to $200. All other conditions remain the same. JVF***

Defendant Adam Charles Hughes in court with attorney Sean Patrick Drury. Defendant Adam Charles Hughes in custody. Veronica Fay Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:12 AM Court calls case.

This case is being addressed, bond amendment.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is being amended to $200, all other conditions remain the same.
